      #include <stdio.h>
      #include <string.h>

      // For the first program:
      int N, M, Q;
      int a[50], b[50], c[50], d[50];   // Q up to 50? The problem doesn't specify, but the Python code uses Q as input. We can set a max, say 50.
      int res1 = 0;   // the result of the first program

      int A[10];   // current sequence for the DFS

      void rec(int len) {
          if (len == N) {
              int ans = 0;
              for (int i = 0; i < Q; i++) {
                  // condition: A[b[i]-1] - A[a[i]-1] == c[i]
                  if (A[b[i]-1] - A[a[i]-1] == c[i]) {
                      ans += d[i];
                  }
              }
              if (ans > res1) res1 = ans;
              return;
          }
          int last_max = (len == 0) ? 1 : A[len-1];
          for (int i = last_max; i <= M; i++) {
              A[len] = i;
              rec(len+1);
          }
      }

      int main() {
          // Step 1: Read input for the first program
          scanf("%d %d %d", &N, &M, &Q);
          for (int i = 0; i < Q; i++) {
              scanf("%d %d %d %d", &a[i], &b[i], &c[i], &d[i]);

          int mmin = 0;

              int v = s2[i] - '0';
              int option1 = pmin + 10 - (v+1);
              int option2 = mmin + 10 - v;
              int npmin = (option1 < option2) ? option1 : option2;
              int option3 = pmin + v+1;
              int option4 = mmin + v;
              int nmmin = (option3 < option4) ? option3 : option4;
              pmin = npmin;
              mmin = nmmin;
          }
          int result2 = (pmin < mmin) ? pmin : mmin;

          // Step 5: Print the final result
          printf("%d\n", result2);

          return 0;
      }
